item.title: Taskwarrior 2.4.0 beta1
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description:
Taskwarrior 2.4.0 is in beta, and available as a source tarball.
Features include: [1] Calc command "task calc '1 + 1'" Hint: it's '2', but it's a beta, so who knows? And yes, it can do more than that.
[2] Enhanced DOM support task add due:123.due
[3] Date math task add ... due:eom wait:'due - 1week'
[4] Unicode: task add \\u2615

item.title: Fish Shell Completion Demo
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description:
Taskwarrior 2.4.0 will be released with a fully updated Fish Shell completion script, from Roman Inflianskas. Here is a demo gif that Roman put together.
The Fish shell has sophisticated completion capabilities, and this update takes full advantage of this.

item.title: Development Status
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description:
Development is shifting focus for Taskwarrior and Taskserver. No more features will be added, and completeness, stability and testing become the new focus.
The goal is to work towards good beta releases for Taskwarrior 2.4.0, Taskserver 1.1.0 and Tasksh 1.0.0.

item.title: Taskwarrior 2.4.0 Preview
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description: The Taskwarrior 2.4.0 development branch has been unusable for a a few weeks (http://taskwarrior.org/news/news.20140524.html) while new functionality was integrated. It has been a long process, with about 750 commits made so far, but now all the tests are passing again.

item.title: Vit 1.2 in homebrew
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description: The recently released Vit 1.2 is now available from Homebrew. Homebrew (http://brew.sh/) is "The missing package manager for OSX", and includes recipes for several thousand packages.

item.title: Taskwarrior 2.4.0 Development Status
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description:
Taskwarrior 2.4.0 is in development. The main feature of this release is a new command line parser, and some related features such as expression evaluation and ISO-8601 date support. This is a major undertaking, but the reward will be some very nice new features.
Until now this work, on the 2.4.0 branch in the code repository has been carefully done so as to not completely break functionality. There are currently 24 failing tests, mostly regarding newly added capabilities.

item.title: Swiss Ubucon Taskwarrior Workshop
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description:
On Saturday May 10th 2014, Dirk Deimeke presented a Taskwarrior workshop at Swiss Ubucon (https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SwissTeam/).
Dirk presented a live demo, with a handout PDF (which we will link here soon) that covers every aspect including downloading, building, installing, setup, first use, all the way to some of the more complex use cases.

item.title: Teaching the Parser New Tricks
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description: With Taskwarrior version 2.4.0, we are building a better command line parser. In addition to fixing a lot of annoying little bugs, we would like it to be more flexible and robust. That means it will be able to handle more strange inputs than before, but can it do better?

item.title: Taskserver Documentation
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description: The Taskserver setup documentation has been significantly improved. The main setup page is: http://taskwarrior.org/docs/server_setup.html The sub pages now cover single topics.

item.title: Q & A Site Launched
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description:
The new Q & A site is live! Take a look at the site, which can be found here:
https://answers.tasktools.org
There is a searchable knowledge base of community-provided questions and answers. The answers are voted and selected, good answers becomes more prominent, bad answers sink lower. You know how it works.

item.title: Vit 1.2 is released
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description:
Version 1.2 of the VIT front-end for Taskwarrior is available for download now.
Download here: http://taskwarrior.org/download/vit-1.2.tar.gz
See the VIT 1.2 beta1 announcement (http://taskwarrior.org/news/news.20140220.html) for the features introduced in 1.2.

item.title: System Status Pages
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description:
New system status pages are online, which provide up to the minute status for the various services now online.
The first is a Pingdom public report showing system status (http://status.tasktools.org/) of the bug system, git hosting, web services and others.
Check this page for outages.
The second is an operations information (http://statuspage.tasktools.org) page from StatusPage.io (http://statuspage.io/) which shows status, uptime, response time and incidents.

item.title: Atlassian Licences
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description: We have received the very generous donation of software licences from Atlassian. This allows us to fully utilize Jira, Stash and Confluence Questions giving us high quality, integrated infrastructure.

item.title: New Site Live
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description: We have shut off the old website, and replaced it with this. Although this site is a fraction of the size, it nevertheless has much less redundancy, and no obsolete documents.

item.title: Registrations Disabled
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description: We have shut off the registration of users on this site. This is part of our ongoing migration to new systems. This taskwarrior.org site content will be replaced soon, but the URLs will not change.

item.title: Vit 1.2 beta1 is available
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description:
Beta1 of the VIT front-end for Taskwarrior is available for download now. Download here:
http://taskwarrior.org/download/vit-1.2.beta1.tar.gz
VIT 1.2 brings a customizable way to interact with your tasks with user-defined shortcuts. You can now define keys to launch external commands.

item.title: Server Migration
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description: As we migrate to our new servers, you'll find that the services are being migrated first, and the content follows after. We are taking this opportunity to reorganize everything.

item.title: Git Migration
item.author: support@taskwarrior.org (Taskwarrior Team)
item.description:
The new repository manager, Stash, is running on the new server
https://git.tasktools.org
The old server will still be active for a little while longer.
